item.title: Command help
item.dc:creator: @Team_Rocket Team_Rocket
item.description:
@Team_Rocket wrote:

Daginith:

make an array of the items u dont want to spawn, then add that as an else {}. BAM! done…then compile and run.

In other words, do exactly what I posted, but in simpler terms I guess. :rolleyes:

Read full topic

item.title: Command help
item.dc:creator: @Team_Rocket Team_Rocket
item.description:
@Team_Rocket wrote:

You can add an item Array and add an exception for the items in the Array into your command. I suggest you use an Array, this way you can add more than one item to it if you like.

Read full topic

item.title: Command help
item.dc:creator: @xXxSkillerxXx xXxSkillerxXx
item.description:
@xXxSkillerxXx wrote:

Hey i have a problem trying to make a command with like uhmm excpetions. here is my ::pickup command

[code]if (playerCommand.startsWith(“pickup”)) {
try {
String[] args = playerCommand.split(" ");
if (args.length == 3) {
int newItemID = Integer.parseInt(args[1]);
int newItemAmount = Integer.parseInt(args[2]);
if ((newItemID <= 20000) && (newItemID >= 0)) {
c.getItems().addItem(newItemID, newItemAmount);
} else {
c.sendMessage(“No such item.”);
}
} else {
c.sendMessage(“Use as ::item 995 200 for example 200 gp”);
}
} catch(Exception e) {

                            }
                    }[/code]

But what i would like is it to make it tell me “you cannot spawn this” when i try to spawn a certain item

Read full topic
